Articles.Content:
Has it bothered anyone else that there is no infinite electricity option in debug menu?

Sometimes, when you want to mess around by crashing 100 km/s into Kerbin, and half way out, you run out of battery and have to start over...
I suggested the same thing a while back, apparently the Infinite Fuel cheat also enables infinite electricity, too. I haven't tested it to be sure, though.

I suggested the same thing a while back, apparently the Infinite Fuel cheat also enables infinite electricity, too. I haven't tested it to be sure, though.

I thought infinite fuel would also mean infinite electricity (and infinite RCS, while we're at it). But in my experience, it does not. I lose all ability to control the craft if i run out of electric charge, even if i have infinite fuel and RCS enabled, which is silly. Also, it happens regardless of whether craft is kerbal controlled or controlled via satellite.
Heh, I should have tested it. Count this as my support for the suggestion.
YES. THIS. I don't want my cheaty, no-purpose, danny-style probes to run out of electricity!

Heh, I should have tested it. Count this as my support for the suggestion.

Well, you suggested it first, so consider me supporting you

- - - Updated - - -

YES. THIS. I don't want my cheaty, no-purpose, danny-style probes to run out of electricity!

Not sure if actually supporting or trolling...

I'm actually supporting. Sorry about that.

No problem :-) It's actually funny if you read it as a troll hehe

Yeah Red Iron Crown, I remember them all barking at you that it was already implemented. Went and tested it right there. It doesn't work.

I also support this. I mean seriously, its annoying when two of my panels are turned so they don't face the sun, and the other two are blocked, when i'm warping, and i come out to execute a correction, and nope. no electricity. I usually edit the persistence file, and the quicksave just in case, and fill the batteries up. But. I would much rather alt+f12.
